text: Khan Yunis refugee camp is a refugee camp in the Gaza Strip. It is just west of the city with the same name. The camp was created after the 1948 Arabâ€“Israeli War. At that time, it had about 35,000 Palestinian refugees. According to UNRWA, the camp had about 72.000 people, in 2010.Khan Younis Refugee Camp Profile. UNRWA. 2010. The Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics recorded a population of 41,182 in the 2017 census. == References == Category:Refugee camps in the Gaza Strip
title: Khan Yunis refugee camp
